page.title: 02Dundale School Fire
page.content: Here is one of the more interesting articles from the Tring and District Gazette dated Friday June 7th 1985. The title is"School hit by mystery gas blaze." A Tring Head Teacher said her school was very very lucky to escape major damage from a blaze on Thursday last week. The cylinder part of a roofing contractor's equipment, could have become a lethal bomb, a fireman said later."That whole side of the school would have gone if it had exploded," he added.Fire tenders from Tring and Berkhamsted rushed to the school after nearby residents raised the alarm at about 8.30p.m. Firemen said that a gas_fired tar_melting heater had caught fire and the heat had set off its supply cylinder.{
